semantic_title: Subsequent Acute Myocardial Infarction Coding Rules and Category I22 Usage
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Chapter 9: Diseases of the Circulatory System > d. Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) > 4. Subsequent acute myocardial infarction

content.full_text: A code from category I22, Subsequent ST elevation (STEMI) and non-ST elevation (NSTEMI) myocardial infarction, is to be used when a patient who has suffered a type 1 or unspecified AMI has a new AMI within the 4 week time frame of the initial AMI. A code from category I22 must be used in conjunction with a code from category I21. The sequencing of the I22 and I21 codes depends on the circumstances of the encounter. Do not assign code I22 for subsequent myocardial infarctions other than type 1 or unspecified. For subsequent type 2 AMI assign only code I21.A1. For subsequent type 4 or type 5 AMI, assign only code I21.A9. If a subsequent myocardial infarction of one type occurs within 4 weeks of a myocardial infarction of a different type, assign the appropriate codes from category I21 to identify each type. Do not assign a code from I22. Codes from category I22 should only be assigned if both the initial and subsequent myocardial infarctions are type 1 or unspecified. (Evidence: pg no: 55, L30-L33)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding subsequent myocardial infarctions using category I22, including timing restrictions, type requirements, and sequencing rules (Evidence: pg no: 55, L30-L33)
key_concepts: Subsequent AMI within 4-week timeframe (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Category I22 restricted to type 1 or unspecified AMI only (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Dual coding requirement with categories I21 and I22 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Different type subsequent AMI coding rules (Evidence: pg no: 55, L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Category I22 codes are used only when subsequent AMI occurs within 4 weeks of initial AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: The 4-week timeframe is critical for determining when to use category I22 versus other coding approaches (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
common_applications: Patient readmitted with new AMI within 4 weeks
Transfer patient with subsequent AMI during initial episode

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign code I22 for subsequent myocardial infarctions other than type 1 or unspecified (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: Category I22 is specifically restricted to type 1 and unspecified AMI types only (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
common_applications: Type 1 STEMI followed by type 1 NSTEMI
Unspecified AMI followed by type 1 AMI

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if patient had previous AMI within 4 weeks
Step 2: Determine type of both initial and subsequent AMI
Step 3: Apply appropriate category I22 or I21 codes based on AMI types
Step 4: Sequence codes based on encounter circumstances

code_ranges.description: Subsequent ST elevation (STEMI) and non-ST elevation (NSTEMI) myocardial infarction (Evidence: pg no: 55, L31)
code_ranges.requirement: Must be used with category I21 code
usage_rules: Only for type 1 or unspecified subsequent AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Must occur within 4 weeks of initial AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)

code_ranges.description: Acute myocardial infarction codes (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
code_ranges.requirement: Must be used in conjunction with I22 when applicable
usage_rules: Use alone for different type subsequent AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L33)
Sequencing depends on encounter circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)

specific_codes.description: Myocardial infarction type 2 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
specific_codes.context: Use only for subsequent type 2 AMI

specific_codes.description: Other myocardial infarction type (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
specific_codes.context: Use only for subsequent type 4 or type 5 AMI

code_patterns.explanation: Both codes required when subsequent AMI meets I22 criteria

code_categories_mentioned: Category I22 - Subsequent STEMI and NSTEMI

references_to.title: Type 1 STEMI and NSTEMI coding
references_to.explanation: Subsequent AMI coding builds on initial AMI type classification

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with type 1 STEMI returns within 3 weeks with new type 1 NSTEMI
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient admitted 3 weeks ago with anterior STEMI, now presents with new inferior NSTEMI
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify both AMIs as type 1
Step 2: Confirm subsequent AMI within 4-week timeframe
Step 3: Assign appropriate I22 code for subsequent NSTEMI
Step 4: Assign appropriate I21 code for initial STEMI

correct_coding.rationale: Both AMIs are type 1 and within 4-week timeframe, requiring I22 category usage (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32-L33)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Missing subsequent AMI designation with I22 category
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only I21 category for subsequent AMI

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with type 1 STEMI returns within 2 weeks with type 2 AMI
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with recent anterior STEMI now has type 2 MI due to septic shock
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify initial AMI as type 1, subsequent as type 2
Step 3: Do not use I22 category
Step 4: Assign only I21.A1 for type 2 AMI

correct_coding.rationale: Different AMI types preclude use of I22 category (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32-L33)

incorrect_coding.rationale: I22 should not be used for type 2 subsequent AMI
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using I22 for non-type 1 subsequent AMI

breakdown.I21: Acute myocardial infarction category (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
breakdown.A9: Other myocardial infarction types including type 4 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)

examples.rationale: Type 4 subsequent AMI uses only I21.A9, not I22 category (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)

warnings: Do not use I22 for subsequent type 2, 4, or 5 AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Do not use I22 when initial and subsequent AMI are different types (Evidence: pg no: 55, L33)
best_practices: Always verify AMI types before applying I22 codes (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32-L33)
Confirm 4-week timeframe for I22 eligibility (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
common_mistakes: Using I22 for type 2 subsequent AMI (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Forgetting to use dual coding with I21 and I22 (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
tips: Sequencing of I22 and I21 depends on encounter circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 55, L32)
Different type subsequent AMI within 4 weeks still uses only I21 codes (Evidence: pg no: 55, L33)
implementation_notes: Category I22 must always be used in conjunction with category I21
4-week timeframe is critical for determining code category usage
clinical_context: Subsequent AMI can occur during same hospitalization or readmission
AMI type classification affects coding category selection
